pull.title: Choose monospaced font in C++ code rather in `*.ui` file
pull.body:
This change makes macOS choose the correct monospaced font.

**fanquake**  noted (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16432#issuecomment-514486077):
> the monospace font looks a bit weird on macOS

... because it is _not_ monospaced.

This is an alternative to #79 as that PR has a Concept NACK from [**luke-jr**](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/79#issuecomment-686510806).

I'm personally still lean to embedding font as it makes the GUI more stable.

repo.name: gui
repo.description: Bitcoin Core GUI staging repository. Please do not fork unless for development reasons.

events.body: @jonasschnelli Should this be considered a bugfix?

Unsure about this.
IMO this is a MVC violation (which we have plenty but unsure to add more).

> IMO this is a MVC violation (which we have plenty but unsure to add more).

How is it so? I think both `qt/overviewpage.cpp` and `qt/forms/overviewpage.ui` belong to "View" in MVC, no?

> How is it so? I think both qt/overviewpage.cpp and qt/forms/overviewpage.ui belong to "View" in MVC, no?

I'd say *.ui is view, *.cpp is controller (the non-automatic generated ones).

> > How is it so? I think both qt/overviewpage.cpp and qt/forms/overviewpage.ui belong to "View" in MVC, no?
> 
> I'd say *.ui is view, *.cpp is controller (the non-automatic generated ones).

Right. But Qt programming usually assumes "the view and the controller objects are combined" (https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/model-view-programming.html).
Looks good to me, one change requested

events.message:
qt: Choose monospaced font in C++ code rather in `*.ui` file

This change makes macOS choose the correct monospaced font.

events.body:
Updated a44ba74ceccf6f61c65972e2ae37327de0db4c79 -> 2e386cd3dd3fea5a22dc8ae871b80a80f8cdb3f7 ([pr87.01](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr87.01) -> [pr87.02](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr87.02), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/compare/pr87.01..pr87.02)):

- addressed @luke-jr's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/87#discussion_r511600141):
> Yes, the downside is that it is explicit and overrides the user's preference (which may not be 10pt).
Tested ACK on macOS 10.15.7 Master PR
Master: This PR: I think the correct monospace font should be bigger and eventually bold.
Adding `f.setPointSize(12);` makes it look much better (on macOS, unsure about windows/linux):

> Adding `f.setPointSize(12);` makes it look much better (on macOS, unsure about windows/linux):

Right. But @luke-jr's opinion is [opposite](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/87#discussion_r511600141).

It would be great to add a font size selector - similar to the console interface. 

![Screen Shot 2021-01-28 at 10 07 51 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/152159/106226484-56502580-61b5-11eb-9137-ef74af03645b.png)
Closed in favor of #207 which should be less controversial.

comments.body: Let's not override this for no reason?
The only reason is to make things explicitly rather than implicitly. Does `setPointSize` call has any downsides?
Yes, the downside is that it is explicit and overrides the user's preference (which may not be 10pt).

Thanks! [Updated](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/87#issuecomment-716163108).

Now I'm able to change the font size with the `qt5ct` utility on Linux Mint 20 :)
